newsitem.title: USA: D.C. police check out package sent to Jewish group.
newsitem.headline: D.C. police check out package sent to Jewish group.

text.p: The police and fire departments are checking out a package, suspected of containing hazardous material, sent to the Jewish group B'nai Brith in downtown Washington, police officials said on Thursday.
"It's not a bomb," a police spokesman said. "The package may have hazardous material. We are trying to develop right now what happened."

According to local television accounts, a bluish envelope was put out on a grassy area by a B'nai Brith employee after it arrived there. The envelope was suspected of containing two vials which might hold some type of hazardous material.
The police spokesman said the area has been sealed off. The office is the international headquarters of the Jewish community group.
Officials from the group were not immediately available for comment.
